intro: Aidia oxyodonta var. microdonta, commonly known as the small-leaf aidia, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
